abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission is reviewing whether Bank of America violated federal securities law by failing to disclose to shareholders Merrill Lynch‘s plan to pay $3.62 billion in bonuses before they voted for the merger of the banks, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission is reviewing whether Bank of America violated federal securities law by failing to disclose to shareholders Merrill Lynch‘s plan to pay $3.62 billion in bonuses before they voted for the merger of the banks, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: S.E.C. Said to Review BofA’s Merrill Bonus Disclosure
